caption: SO GOOD. Loved the drinks, vibes & tacos here! We had mulled wine & the Oaxaca’s Manhattan. The handmade tortillas were incredible & the dessert was the best. Also they have a great Spotify Playlist. If you go, make a reservation so the staff can accommodate you as best as possible in this intimate space!
Best food and drinks in the North East! Insanely obsessed.

Straight from Mexico City, Paola, one of the owners  @barra.unionsquare in Somerville, opened this authentic and at the same time creative Mexican restaurant and bar, tapas style, just three weeks before the pandemic closedown in Massachusetts. As a real chilanga, born and raised in Mexico City, one of the largest cities in the world with a rich culinary culture, I can tell you that this place made me feel like I was back in Coyoacan, one of the most hip places in Mexico City, with the best places to hang out and eat. @barra.unionsquare  you can find real tacos, salsas,  and some creative dishes like Tetela, that I tried for the first time, and a good selection of mezcal and non commercial tequila brands, tamales and tostadas that feel home made. In a cozy and secluded patio to chill and enjoy great food and great service. You can’t go wrong. We will be back!

This cozy spot was such an accidental find for me and I had an absolutely lovely time here. I got the ceviche which was fresh and bright and I highly recommend the chips and salsa and grasshopper on the side. As an entre I got the Gringa which was phenomenal. The drinks here were also next level. We tried the Mezcal margarita, Sotol flight, Sotol cocktail and the Agualoca. The hosts here were so incredibly hospitable and even offered us a dessert drink at the end. I can't recommend this place enough.

Staff is very friendly and attentive. Food and drinks very well balanced - never too sweet!  I could hang out in their back patio an entire day!  Must haves: Mezcal Old Fashioned Red Sangria Tacos de Cecina Enchiladas Memelitas
Great food and atmosphere (really nice back patio) above and beyond my expectations!
Great cocktails, fresh and delicious food! Looking forward to going back!
Tiny portions for the price. Ripoff. Don't bother. Food looked and tasted like a $3 food cart dish, not a $15 item from a restaurant menu. 2 stars only because the cocktail mixer was pretty good.
Super friendly service and the food is AMAZING!!
Food and drinks were great, small plate sizes though so order more than one dish if you're hungry.
The service is excellent, the food is exceptionally fresh and tasty. Prices are appropriate but not cheap, for tapas. Seriously, try the grasshopper-cadamom salt on fresh orange slices.

Absolute gem. Had an amazing time munching on freshly made blue corn tacos that one hardly gets to see at a Mexican restaurant. The food was delicious, carefully crafted, and unique. The place is small but has a lot of character and an extensive and innovative drink menu. Try the Agave Caipirinha.

My friends and I happened to stumble into this cozy Mexico City themed Mezcal bar on a Saturday night. After chatting with the owners/bartenders we were surprised to learned they had opened just a few hours prior. You can't wrong with any drinks, but I especially liked the Mezcal/Soto sipping options. The bartenders are knowledgeable and happy to provide suggestions to people like me who are clueless when it comes to Mezcal. Grab a seat quick before this place blows up!
